content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #84097 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

I'm unsure about this one.

On one hand I personally have the feeling of a general trend of Rust compiling taking more and more time, resources and disk space (see this issue), but I don't have the context to assess how off I am in this respect. I would be happy to be given a context.

On the other I'd like issues like this to be closely analyzed because (I think) they're important for the ecosystem of a system programming language
issues are not a great way to track compile time, I'd suggest https://perf.rust-lang.org/dashboard.html for that
perf.rlo also tracks compile memory but I don't know if it has a dashboard for it
I don't think disk space is tracked very well unfortunately
I'd ping the cleanup crew, as this sounds like it needs a root cause before we prioritize.
